questions.explanation: Information systems are designed to support decision making, control, coordination, and analysis within organizations.

questions.q: Which of the following best describes data?
questions.explanation: Data refers to raw, unprocessed facts and figures without context or meaning.

questions.q: Information differs from data because information is?
questions.explanation: Information is data that has been processed and organized to provide meaning and support decision making.

questions.q: Which activity converts data into useful outputs?
questions.explanation: Processing transforms raw data into meaningful information.

questions.q: Feedback in an information system is used to?
questions.explanation: Feedback helps adjust input or processing to improve system performance.

questions.q: Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of valuable information?
questions.explanation: Valuable information should be economical, not expensive.

options: A structured group of people with goals
questions.explanation: An organization is a structured group of people working together to achieve goals.

questions.q: Which IS role focuses on daily business activities?
questions.explanation: Managing operations focuses on supporting day-to-day business activities.

questions.q: Business Intelligence is mainly related to?
questions.explanation: Business Intelligence focuses on analyzing data to support better decision making.

questions.q: Which component of IS includes hardware and software?
questions.explanation: Technology includes hardware, software, and telecommunications.
BPM is concerned with designing, optimizing, and improving business processes.

questions.q: Which IS component represents raw facts?
questions.explanation: Data represents raw facts used by information systems.

questions.q: Which stage of the information processing cycle saves data for future use?
questions.explanation: Storage keeps data and information for future use.
Competitive advantage means having an edge or lead over competitors.

questions.q: Manual systems are different from computer-based systems because they?
options: Depend on people rather than technology
questions.explanation: Manual systems rely heavily on human effort rather than technology.
SDLC stands for Software Development Life Cycle.

questions.q: The SDLC process is considered a cycle because?
questions.explanation: SDLC is cyclical because feedback can cause phases to repeat or improve.

questions.q: Which SDLC phase focuses on understanding business needs?
questions.explanation: Requirement Gathering & Analysis focuses on understanding business needs.
Functional requirements define what the system must do.
Non-functional requirements describe quality attributes like performance and security.

questions.q: Which phase converts logical designs into physical solutions?
questions.explanation: Implementation is where designs are converted into working systems.

questions.q: Unit testing is mainly performed during?
questions.explanation: Unit testing is done during implementation as code is written.

questions.q: Which testing type ensures the system meets business needs?
questions.explanation: User Acceptance Testing confirms the system meets business requirements.
Deployment is the release of the system to the production environment.
Maintenance involves fixing bugs and updating the system after deployment.
As-Is system describes the current system in use.
Waterfall follows a sequential phase-by-phase approach.

questions.q: One disadvantage of the Waterfall model is?
questions.explanation: Waterfall is inflexible and difficult to change once phases are completed.
Parallel development reduces development time by working on subprojects simultaneously.
RAD emphasizes rapid development and early user feedback.
Iterative development delivers multiple versions incrementally.

questions.q: A disadvantage of iterative development is?
questions.explanation: Early versions are intentionally incomplete in iterative development.
Agile emphasizes individuals and interactions over processes and tools.

questions.q: Which Agile value prefers working software over documents?
questions.explanation: V2 emphasizes working software over comprehensive documentation.
Agile welcomes changing requirements, even late in development.
The backlog is an ordered list of work items to be completed.
Methodology selection depends on factors like system complexity.
System analysts focus on analyzing business problems and requirements.
Technical skills help analysts understand system technologies.
Business skills ensure the system delivers real business value.
Analytical skills help in problem solving and data analysis.
Interpersonal skills are essential for communication with stakeholders.
Ethical skills relate to issues such as data privacy and confidentiality.
Business analysts focus on identifying and delivering business value.

questions.q: A requirements analyst is responsible for?
questions.explanation: Requirements analysts focus on eliciting and documenting requirements.
Infrastructure analysts focus on hardware, networks, and technical infrastructure.
Agile uses minimal documentation that supports development.

options: At the end of the project
questions.explanation: Agile reviews are conducted after each sprint.
System analysts act as change agents within organizations.

questions.q: The main goal of Agile is?
questions.explanation: Agile aims to deliver maximum value to the customer.

questions.q: Data is more meaningful than information.
questions.explanation: Information is more meaningful because it is processed data.

questions.q: An information system only consists of hardware and software.
questions.explanation: Information systems also include people, processes, and data.

questions.q: Feedback is used to improve system performance.
questions.explanation: Feedback helps adjust input and processing to improve performance.

questions.q: Functional requirements describe system quality attributes.
questions.explanation: System quality attributes are described by non-functional requirements.

questions.q: SDLC phases may vary between organizations.
questions.explanation: Organizations may adapt SDLC phases to their needs.
Waterfall is rigid and does not handle changes easily.
RAD relies on early and frequent user feedback.

questions.q: Agile values working software over comprehensive documentation.
questions.explanation: This is one of the core Agile values.

questions.q: A system analyst must have only technical skills.
questions.explanation: System analysts need technical, business, analytical, and interpersonal skills.

questions.q: Agile always requires a complete project plan at the beginning.
questions.explanation: Agile favors flexibility and evolving plans over fixed upfront planning.
